detaileddescription.para:
Leave the driver letters and / or \ letters from beginning of the path
path
path string (E.g. S:/folder/file.txt)
pointer to the beginning of the real path (E.g. folder/file.txt)

Give a pointer to a driver from its letter
letter
the driver letter
pointer to a driver or NULL if not found
Initialize the File system interface

Test if a drive is rady or not. If the ready function was not initialized true will be returned.
letter
letter of the drive
true: drive is ready; false: drive is not ready

Open a file
file_p
pointer to a lv_fs_file_t variable
path
path to the file beginning with the driver letter (e.g. S:/folder/file.txt)
mode
read: FS_MODE_RD, write: FS_MODE_WR, both: FS_MODE_RD | FS_MODE_WR
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from lv_fs_res_t enum

Close an already opened file
file_p
pointer to a lv_fs_file_t variable
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from lv_fs_res_t enum

Delete a file
path
path of the file to delete
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from lv_fs_res_t enum

Read from a file
file_p
pointer to a lv_fs_file_t variable
buf
pointer to a buffer where the read bytes are stored
btr
Bytes To Read
br
the number of real read bytes (Bytes Read). NULL if unused.
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from lv_fs_res_t enum

Write into a file
file_p
pointer to a lv_fs_file_t variable
buf
pointer to a buffer with the bytes to write
btr
Bytes To Write
br
the number of real written bytes (Bytes Written). NULL if unused.
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from lv_fs_res_t enum

Set the position of the 'cursor' (read write pointer) in a file
file_p
pointer to a lv_fs_file_t variable
pos
the new position expressed in bytes index (0: start of file)
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from lv_fs_res_t enum

Give the position of the read write pointer
file_p
pointer to a lv_fs_file_t variable
pos_p
pointer to store the position of the read write pointer
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from 'fs_res_t'

Truncate the file size to the current position of the read write pointer
file_p
pointer to an 'ufs_file_t' variable. (opened with lv_fs_open )
LV_FS_RES_OK: no error, the file is read any error from lv_fs_res_t enum

Give the size of a file bytes
file_p
pointer to a lv_fs_file_t variable
size
pointer to a variable to store the size
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from lv_fs_res_t enum

Rename a file
oldname
path to the file
newname
path with the new name
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from 'fs_res_t'

Initialize a 'fs_read_dir_t' variable for directory reading
rddir_p
pointer to a 'fs_read_dir_t' variable
path
path to a directory
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from lv_fs_res_t enum

Read the next filename form a directory. The name of the directories will begin with '/'
rddir_p
pointer to an initialized 'fs_read_dir_t' variable
fn
pointer to a buffer to store the filename
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from lv_fs_res_t enum

Close the directory reading
rddir_p
pointer to an initialized 'fs_read_dir_t' variable
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from lv_fs_res_t enum

Get the free and total size of a driver in kB
letter
the driver letter
total_p
pointer to store the total size [kB]
free_p
pointer to store the free size_cb [kB]
LV_FS_RES_OK or any error from lv_fs_res_t enum

Initialize a file system driver with default values. It is used to surly have known values in the fields ant not memory junk. After it you can set the fields.
drv
pointer to driver variable to initialize

Add a new drive
drv_p
pointer to an lv_fs_drv_t structure which is inited with the corresponding function pointers. The data will be copied so the variable can be local.

Fill a buffer with the letters of existing drivers
buf
buffer to store the letters ('\0' added after the last letter)
the buffer

Return with the extension of the filename
fn
string with a filename
pointer to the beginning extension or empty string if no extension

Step up one level
path
pointer to a file name
the truncated file name

Get the last element of a path (e.g. U:/folder/file -> file)
path
a character sting with the path to search in
pointer to the beginning of the last element in the path
